QRID.question: QRID. Respondent ID (UNIQUE TO EACH RESPONDENT)

Q1.question: Q1. Overall, are you satisfied, dissatisfied, or neither satisfied nor dissatisfied with the way things are going in [SURVEY PUBLIC] today?

Q2a.question: Q2a. In a family, who should be primarily responsible for the following activities? a. Earning money

Q2b.question: Q2b. In a family, who should be primarily responsible for the following activities? b. Taking care of children

Q2c.question: Q2c. In a family, who should be primarily responsible for the following activities? c. Making decisions about expenses

Q2d.question: Q2d. In a family, who should be primarily responsible for the following activities? d. Taking care of aging family members

Q3.question: Q3. Which of these statements comes closest to your opinion even if neither is exactly right?

options.1: Women have an obligation to society to bear children
options.2: Women should decide for themselves whether or not to bear children

Q4.question: Q4. Which of these three statements comes closest to your opinion?

options.1: Men generally make better political leaders than women
options.2: Women generally make better political leaders than men
options.3: In general, women and men make equally good political leaders

QBORN.question: QBORN. Would you describe yourself as a born-again or evangelical Christian?

Q7a.question: Q7a. Just based on what you know, do you think each of the following descriptions fits Buddhism, or not? a. Buddhism is a family tradition one must follow

Q7b.question: Q7b. Just based on what you know, do you think each of the following descriptions fits Buddhism, or not? b. Buddhism is an ethnicity one is born into

Q7c.question: Q7c. Just based on what you know, do you think each of the following descriptions fits Buddhism, or not? c. Buddhism is a culture one is part of

Q7d.question: Q7d. Just based on what you know, do you think each of the following descriptions fits Buddhism, or not? d. Buddhism is a set of ethical teachings to guide actions

Q7e.question: Q7e. Just based on what you know, do you think each of the following descriptions fits Buddhism, or not? e. Buddhism is a religion one chooses to follow

Q8a.question: Q8a. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? a. do not respect elders

Q8b.question: Q8b. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? b. do not respect [SURVEY PUBLIC]

Q8c.question: Q8c. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? c. do not respect deities or spirits

Q8d.question: Q8d. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? d. never go to temple or pagoda

Q8e.question: Q8e. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? e. do not pray

Q8f.question: Q8f. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? f. drink alcohol

Q8g.question: Q8g. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? g. celebrate the Christian festival of Christmas

Q8h.question: Q8h. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? h. celebrate the Muslim festival of Eid

Q8i.question: Q8i. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? i. make offerings to or worship ancestors

Q8j.question: Q8j. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? j. do not believe in the afterlife

Q8k.question: Q8k. In your opinion, can a person be truly Buddhist if they do each of the following things? k. do not have a Buddhist funeral

options.1: People should be allowed to speak their opinions publicly even if they upset other people
options.2: Harmony with others is more important than the right to speak one's opinion

options.1: Yes, should be able to publicly criticize the government
options.2: No, should not be able to publicly criticize the government
